Name: Neu Laxova syndrome
Synonyms_List__c: 3-phosphoglycerate dehydrogenase deficiency, neonatal form, Neu-Laxova syndrome, NLS
Disease_Description__c: Neu-Laxova syndrome is an autosomal recessive lethal multiple malformation syndrome characterized by ichthyosis, marked intrauterine growth restriction, microcephaly, short neck, central nervous system anomalies (lissencephaly, cerebellar hypoplasia and/or abnormal/agenesis of the corpus callosum), limb deformities, hypoplastic lungs, edema, and abnormal facial features including severe proptosis with ectropion, hypertelorism, micrognathia, flattened nose, and malformed ears (summary by Manning et al., 2004).Genetic Heterogeneity of Neu-Laxova SyndromeNLS2 (616038) is caused by mutation in the PSAT1 gene (610936) on chromosome 9q21.
